translation: uznanie [public approval and praise]
sentence: The scientist earned acclaim for his remarkable achievement in the field of DNA research.

translation: przejście [a passage between rows of seats in a church, theater, train, etc., or between rows of shelves in a supermarket]
sentence: Would you like an aisle seat or would you prefer to be by the window?

translation: ująć, zaaresztować [formal; to catch and arrest someone who has not obeyed the law]
sentence: The police have finally apprehended the killer.

translation: czcigodny, dostojny, majestatyczny [formal; having great importance and especially of the highest social class]
sentence: We toured the august chambers of the Supreme Court.

translation: wzdrygać się przed czymś, zapierać się [to be unwilling to do something or become involved in something because it is difficult, dangerous, etc.]
sentence: Many parents may balk at the idea of paying $100 for a pair of shoes.

translation: przekomarzanie, droczenie się [friendly remarks and jokes]
sentence: He enjoyed exchanging banter with the customers.

translation: błagać, zaklinać [literary; to ask for something in a way that shows you need it very much]
sentence: Let him go, I beseech you!

translation: szkoła z internatem [a school where students live and study]
sentence: This means helping those parents who choose a boarding school education and those parents who choose a day school.

translation: mosiądz [a bright yellow metal made from copper and zinc]
sentence: The door handles were made of brass.

translation: drażnić, ocierać [to make or become damaged or sore by rubbing]
sentence: That bracelet chafed my wrist.

translation: poświęcić, konsekrować [to officially make something holy and able to be used for religious ceremonies]
sentence: The new cathedral was completed and consecrated in 2002.

translation: przyrząd, machina [a device or machine that looks awkward or old-fashioned, especially one that you do not know how to use]
sentence: What's that strange contraption in the garage?

translation: drobniutki [formal; very small]
sentence: He's a diminutive figure, less than five feet tall.

translation: usposobienie, charakter [the particular type of character that a person naturally has]
sentence: Even though the old man appeared grumpy, he really had a pleasant disposition.

translation: roztrzęsiony [extremely upset and anxious so that you cannot think clearly]
sentence: She's still too distraught to speak about the tragedy.

translation: uprzykrzać życie [(of a problem or bad luck) to cause you trouble for a long time]
sentence: He had been dogged by bad health all his life.

translation: gryzmolić [to draw lines, shapes, etc., especially when you are bored or thinking about something else]
sentence: I often doodle when I'm on the phone.

translation: zniewieściały [(of a man or a boy) looking, behaving, or sounding like a woman or a girl]
sentence: He's got a very effeminate voice.

translation: ujście rzeki [the wide part of a river at the place where it joins the sea]
sentence: The Gabun, in reality an estuary of the sea, lies immediately north of the equator.

translation: naciągany [very unlikely to be true, and difficult to believe]
sentence: The whole story sounds very far-fetched.

translation: wybredny, drobiazgowy [giving too much attention to small details and wanting everything to be correct and perfect]
sentence: He is very fastidious about how a suitcase should be packed.

translation: schlebiać, prawić komplementy [to praise someone in order to make them feel attractive or important, sometimes in a way that is not sincere]
sentence: I knew he was only flattering me because he wanted to borrow some money.

translation: obdzierać ze skóry, zdejmować skórę [to remove the skin from an animal or person, usually when they are dead]
sentence: The hunter flayed the rabbit and prepared it for cooking.

translation: fałszować [to make an illegal copy of something in order to deceive]
sentence: He's getting good at forging his mother's signature.

translation: frywolność, błazenada [behavior that is silly or amusing, especially when this is not suitable]
sentence: It was just a piece of harmless frivolity.

translation: główna myśl, sedno [the main or general meaning of a piece of writing, a speech, or a conversation]
sentence: I missed the beginning of the lecture—can you give me the gist of what he said?

translation: rozlana krew [thick blood that has flowed from a wound, especially in a violent situation]
sentence: It's a good film, but there's a lot of blood and gore in it.

translation: ryczeć ze śmiechu [to laugh loudly, especially at something stupid that someone has said or done]
sentence: They all guffawed at his jokes.

translation: bulgotać [(of water, especially small streams) to flow quickly while making a low, pleasant sound]
sentence: Outside of her window the stream gurgled over the rocks.

translation: rynna [a long, open pipe that is fixed to the edge of a roof to carry water away]
sentence: Every fall we have to clean leaves out of the gutters.

translation: w pobliżu, w tej okolicy [in this area, or near this place]
sentence: Any trouble hereabouts is swiftly dealt with by the police.

translation: rękojeść [the handle of a sharp-pointed weapon such as a sword]
sentence: One of his hands rested on the hilt of his sword.

translation: wyć [(of a dog, wolf, etc.) to make a long loud cry]
sentence: In the silence of the night, a lone wolf howled.

translation: garb [a large lump that sticks out above the surface of something, especially the ground; a round raised part on a person's or animal's back]
sentence: Some types of camel have two humps and others have one.

translation: bożek [a picture or object that people pray to as part of their religion]
sentence: The ancient people of this area worshipped a huge bronze idol in the shape of an elephant.

translation: nieożywiony [having none of the characteristics of life that an animal or plant has]
sentence: He looks at me as if I'm an inanimate object.

translation: upokorzenie, zniewaga [something that causes a loss of respect for someone or for yourself]
sentence: The chairman suffered the indignity of being refused admission to the meeting.

translation: niemoc, zniedołężnienie [illness, especially for long periods or because of old age]
sentence: We all fear disability or infirmity.

translation: nie do wykonania/przezwyciężenia [formal; (of difficulties, problems, etc.) that cannot be dealt with successfully]
sentence: This small country is faced with an insurmountable debt.

translation: nieustępliwy, bezkompromisowy [formal disapproving; (of people) unwilling to change their opinions or behavior in a way that would be helpful to others]
sentence: Unions claim that the management continues to maintain an intransigent position.

translation: wyspa [literary; (used especially in place names) an island]
sentence: Explore the more remote Caribbean isles.

translation: rozleniwienie, rozmarzenie [literary; pleasant mental or physical tiredness or lack of activity]
sentence: She missed Spain and the languor of a siesta on a hot summer afternoon.

translation: wiązadło [a piece of strong tissue in the body that holds bones together]
sentence: She tore a ligament in her knee while she was playing basketball.

translation: pościel (lniana lub z podobnego materiału)
sentence: There's extra linen in the closet.

translation: ckliwy, cukierkowy [(disapproving) expressing or sharing emotion in a way that is exaggerated or embarrassing]
sentence: The film lapses into mawkish sentimentality near the end.

translation: położna [a person, usually a woman, who is trained to help women when they are giving birth]
sentence: The midwife was already on her way to meet her, rubbing her small, plump white hands with an air of calm importance.

translation: mikroskopijny [extremely small]
sentence: All she gave him to eat was two minuscule pieces of toast.

translation: wstrętny, odpychający [formal; extremely unpleasant and causing or deserving hate]
sentence: By making religion hard it made it odious, and thus prepared the way for unbelief.

translation: złowieszczy [suggesting that something unpleasant is likely to happen]
sentence: There was an ominous silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.

translation: rozpieszczać, dogadzać [to give someone special treatment, making that person as comfortable as possible and giving them whatever they want]
sentence: She pampers her dog with the finest steak and salmon.

translation: stronniczy [showing too much support for one person, group, or idea, especially without considering it carefully]
sentence: Most newspapers are politically partisan.

translation: wisiorek [a piece of jewellery worn around the neck, consisting of a long chain with an object hanging from it, or the object itself]
sentence: She was wearing a crystal pendant.

translation: rzucić się na, skoczyć na [to suddenly move towards a person or animal that you want to catch]
sentence: The cat sat in the tree ready to pounce on the ducks below.

translation: oskarżyć, zaskarżyć [to officially charge someone with a crime in court]
sentence: The company was prosecuted for breaching the Occupational Safety and Health Act.

translation: oddalać się, maleć [to move further away into the distance, or to become less clear or less bright]
sentence: As the boat picked up speed, the coastline receded into the distance until finally it became invisible.

translation: wonny, przypominający coś zapachem [literary; smelling strongly of something or having qualities (especially smells) that make you think of something else]
sentence: The mountain air was redolent with the scent of pine needles.

translation: wynagrodzenie [formal; payment for work or services]
sentence: They demanded adequate remuneration for their work.

translation: ganić [formal; to tell someone that you do not approve of something that they have done]
sentence: The teacher gently reproved the boys for not paying attention.

translation: grzbiet, grań [a long, narrow piece of high land, especially along the top of a mountain]
sentence: We walked along the narrow mountain ridge.

translation: skóra głowy [the skin that covers the part of the head where the hair grows]
sentence: A dry scalp can lead to dandruff.

translation: rzadki, ograniczony [rare or not available in large amounts]
sentence: Food and clean water were becoming scarce.

translation: wartownik, strażnik [a soldier who guards a place, usually by standing at its entrance]
sentence: People approaching the gate were challenged by the sentry.

translation: jąkanie [the act of saying something, especially the first part of a word, with difficulty, for example pausing or repeating a sound several times]
sentence: During the 1970s and 1980s, rival theories about what causes stuttering came into vogue.

translation: kutas, frędzel [a group of short threads or ropes held together at one end, used as a hanging decoration on hats, curtains, furniture, etc.]
sentence: A tassel of silk or satin ribbons hangs from the handle.

translation: targać, szarpać [to pull something hard, often several times]
sentence: She tugged at his sleeve to get his attention.

translation: wydźwięk, nuta, podtekst [a particular but not obvious characteristic that a piece of writing or speech, an event, or a situation has]
sentence: I thought her speech had slightly sinister undertones.

translation: obicie, tapicerka [the material that covers chairs and other types of seats]
sentence: The car had been shut up long enough that it smelled of old upholstery.

translation: wola [the power to choose something freely or to make your own decisions]
sentence: They left entirely of their own volition.

translation: zmysłowa, ponętna; lubieżny [(formal) (of a woman) attractive in a sexual way with large breasts and hips; (literary) giving you physical pleasure]
sentence: She was very pretty and voluptuous.

translation: cudowny, zdumiewający [literary; extremely and surprisingly good; strange, beautiful, and impressive]
sentence: Our new improved moisturizer has wondrous effects on tired-looking skin.
